title: Every iteration of warlords bloodlust has been toxic as hell.
body:
The original wb restored 15% of any critical strike, and instantly yasuo and tryndamere became broken because it gave them insane sustain. It was hotfixed so it only works against champions. This caused it to only be viable on champions that have natural crit in their kit. It was reworked to just give you lifesteal based on how low you are, up to 20%. It made bot lane so uninteractive because adcs had ridiculous sustain, that they nerfed it shortly after so it is inly 1/4 effective against non champions for ranged and 1/2 for melee. Even then, it was still op on adcs like cait and draven as they use their ridiculous damage and cait now started rushing triple crit due to not having to buy lifesteal. However, it could be mitigated to an extent by armor. It was just a "stat stick" keystone. Earlier this season, riot reworked again to something charge based, where if you move around and attack you get stacks. At 100 stacks, your next auto lifesteals 5-40% of your ad unmitigated, and can be boosted by crit with no penalty and also gives a massive burst of movespeed. It also has no penalty for ranged champions. It usually triggers every 4-6 seconds. Again champs like draven and cait abused this to no end as it gives them so much free survivability. Cait especially as she continued to rush  triple crit to obtain massive damage since she doesn't have to buy lifesteal. Draven was also bad as he now usually buys death dance, which may give him just enough time to get another warlord proc, giving him 300+ hp in addition to the lifesteal he has. This combined with lifesteal makes him survive fights that he should have died in 3-4 seconds ago. However, the biggest abuser was jhin; since he has extremely high ad and his 4th shot is a guarnteed crit. I have seen a jhin heal 1200 off of just 1 auto attack and he had 700 ms after that, escaping what should have been a death.
tldr: warlords shouldn't have even existed as copious amounts of free sustain can't be balanced at all.
